Kam Heskin conquered haunting memories of an awkward childhood, a failed career in fast food and a stint on Sunset Beach to find professional success in Tomcats .
TIPS FOR THE FRY BOYS: “I’ve worked at every fast-food restaurant and menial job there is. And I got fired from them all. At Taco Bell, they made me a sweeper. They kept me away from the food. One time a woman called me over to complain about her brown lettuce. I tried to help her, but the other employees ignored me. Finally, I shouted, ‘Guys, there’s something wrong with the lettuce!’ The manager was livid. You can’t say that in front of customers.”
WANTED: FRANKENSTEIN WITH CASH: “I’m attracted to strength in a man. Not just physical—though I do have a thing for broad shoulders—but the kind of strength of character that means he can be his own person and allow me to do my thing. I don’t like cheapness. I like chivalry in a man, where he’ll pick up the bill and not go over it, saying, ‘You had this; I had that.’”
THAT’S OUR FAVORITE POWER TOOL, TOO! “I love drills. I’m a drilling fanatic. Whenever I move, the first thing I do is get out the drill and start hanging pictures. The heavier the picture, the better. I fix things while my boyfriend is in the kitchen scrambling eggs or something. Also, the electric saw. I love the heat and smell of cutting wood.”
“I was a really late bloomer. I didn’t talk to a lot of people in junior high and high school. No boyfriends. I didn’t think of myself as pretty at all. I had a silly perm and wore glasses, and I was so skinny.”
